page.title: 02Princes Park
page.content:
Princes Park is one of the oldest parks in Liverpool. Near the entrance to the park from Princes Avenue is a polished red granite obelisk which remembers the person who founded Princes Park. The inscription says:
To the memory of RICHARD VAUGHAN YATES The enlightened and philanthropic Founder of Prince's Park Erected by Public Subscription 1858.
This obelisk was erected to remember the generosity of Richard Yates who bought Princes Park from the Earl of Sefton. He then designed the park layout and donated it the general public.
